## Basic information
- Chemical formula(s): Complex mixture containing sodium deoxycholate (1-5%), sodium cholate (1-5%), tryptone, X-glucuronide chromogen
- Other names: TBX agar, Harlequin™ Tryptone Bile Glucuronide Agar
- CAS number: Not applicable (mixture)
- Product Code: NCM1001 (Neogen)
- International Chemical Safety Card (ICSC): N/A (see [Neogen Safety Data Sheet](https://www.neogen.com/4ae1fe/globalassets/pim/assets/original/10041/ncm1001_sds_en-ph.pdf))
- Flammability: yes (combustible powder)
- Description: Dehydrated microbiological culture medium for enumeration of E. coli. Contains bile salts as selective agent and X-glucuronide as chromogenic substrate. ISO 16649 compliant.

## NFPA 704 (fire diamond)

![](../media/nfpa704/100.png){width=15% fig-align="center"}

- **Health (blue): 1** - poses minimal health hazard, may cause irritation.
- **Flammability (red): 0** - will not burn under typical fire conditions.
- **Instability–reactivity (yellow): 0** - normally stable, even under fire exposure conditions, and is not reactive with water.
- **Special notice (white): -**

## Hazard statements
According to the safety data sheet, this product is not classified as hazardous under GHS. However, components have the following classifications:

| Code | Phrase                                                         |
| ---- | -------------------------------------------------------------- |
| H302 | harmful if swallowed (sodium deoxycholate component)         |
| H315 | causes skin irritation (bile salt components)                |
| H319 | causes serious eye irritation (bile salt components)         |

## Protective measures

### Gloves
For handling TBX medium powder:

- **Nitrile**: **very good** - chemical-resistant gloves made of any waterproof material recommended.
- **Natural latex or rubber**: **good** - adequate for routine handling.
- **PVC**: **fair** - provides basic protection against irritants.
- **Vinyl**: **fair** - minimal protection, suitable for brief contact only.

### Safety goggles
- Use appropriate suitable eye protection when handling.
- May cause irritation to eyes - avoid contact.
- Corrective glasses are not considered safety goggles.
- Use tight-fitting chemical safety goggles.

### Clothing
- Wear protective clothing to prevent skin contact.
- Long sleeves and full-length pants required.
- Closed-toe shoes mandatory.
- Wash contaminated clothing separately from other laundry before reuse.
- May cause skin irritation - minimize skin exposure.

### Respiratory protection
- In case of insufficient ventilation, wear suitable respiratory equipment.
- Dust may be irritating if inhaled.
- May cause irritation to respiratory system.
- Use fume hood or local exhaust ventilation when preparing media.

## Spill management
- Avoid formation of dust - do not sweep dry material.
- Use wet cleanup methods or vacuum with appropriate filter.
- Clean spillage area thoroughly with plenty of water.
- Do not contaminate water by cleaning of equipment or disposal of wastes.
- Prevent further spillage if safe - do not flush into surface water.
- Do not let product contaminate subsoil.
- Dispose according to local and national regulations.

## Special warnings
- **Contains bile salts** - sodium deoxycholate and sodium cholate (1-5% each).
- **May be harmful if swallowed** - contains materials which may be harmful if swallowed.
- **Dust may be irritating if inhaled** - avoid breathing dust.
- **Microbiological media** - may support growth of pathogenic microorganisms after hydration.
- **Not classified as hazardous** - but contains components with hazard classifications.
- Store at temperatures between 2°C and 30°C.
- Keep container tightly closed and protect from moisture.
- **Hygroscopic** - absorbs moisture from air, affecting media performance.
- **ISO 16649 compliant** - meets international standards for E. coli enumeration.
- **For in vitro use only** - intended for laboratory analytics including quality control.
- Keep away from extreme temperatures and moisture.
- **May cause allergic reactions** in susceptible people.
- Follow label instructions for preparation and use.
